intro: Coussarea linearis, commonly known as the slender coussarea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and are fragrant. Coussarea linearis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
